The impulse starts in a small bundle of  specialized cells located in the right atrium called SA node. The electrical  activity spreads through the walls of the atria and cause them to contract.
This forces blood into the ventricles. The SA node sets the rate ,& rhythm of your heartbeat. 1. Arrhythmia - irregular rhythm of the heartbeat.   2. Tachycardia - fast heartbeat than the normal. 3. Bradycardia- slow heartbeat. Heart

Headache, dizziness, profuse sweating, hot skin, fever, coarse breathing, dry mouth and tongue, great thirst, superficial -large-rapid pulse Mild Sunstroke Vital organs such as Heart, Lungs, Kidneys, Liver and Brain
High Fever, Headache, Shortness of Breath. Great thirst, Collapse,Loss of Consiousness, Delirium, Sweating, Deep and Forceless Pulse    Severe Sunstroke Life threatening Condition
Dizziness, Vertigo,Loss of consiousness, , Cold Limbs,Pallor, Feeble breath with mouth open,spontaneous sweating, Deep and thready pulse Fainting - deficiency type Brief  Loss of consiousness
Sudden Collapse, Loss of Consiousness, clenched Jaws, Rigid Limbs,Coarse breathing, Deep and excess type of pulse Fainting - Excess type Loss of Consiousness

Lethargy, Sleepiness, Confusion, cold-sweaty-bluish pale skin, weak & rapid pulse, rapid breathing, BP drops so low that it cannot be measured SHOCK Life threatening condition in which Blood pressure is so low to sustain Life

Stupor, daze, No appetite, heaviness in head and chest, leukorrhea, loose stools, slow and slippery pulse, sweet or no taste Stupor Hypersomnia, deep long sleep like state from which a person can be awakened only briefly
Closed eyes, Flaccid mouth, hands loose, cheeks red, snoring, no control over excretory functions, cold limbs Abandoned condition Coma Deep unconsciousness state
Tightly clenched hands, inability to move bowels or urinate, clenched teeth, flushed face, rough breathing, presence of phlegm Closed condition Coma Deep unconsiousness

Coma, dementia, mental confusion, sometimes mind clear and sometimes cloudy, cough and dyspnea, excess phlegm and salivation, low grade fever, thick and slimmy tongue coat, slippery and rapid pulse Coma and Mental confusion caused by phlegm Deep unconsiousness

Coma, delirium, high fever, burning hotness on hand, eruptions of the body, epistaxis, convulsion, scanty salivation, deep yellow coat on deep yellow tongue Coma due to Attack of noxious heat on Pericardium Deep unconsiousness

Coma, Delirium, vexation, irritation, abdominal fullness, constipation, afternoon tidal fever, prickles on tongue, yellow coat on deep red tongue, deep and forceful pulse Coma caused by accumulation of constipated excreta in Yang organs Deep unconsiousness

Coma, cloudiness of mind, mania, high fever at night, pain in lower abdomen, purpura over the body, cyanosis of lips and nails, dark urine, constipation, dark red or cyanotic tongue, deep and replete pulse Coma caused by obstructions, stagnation and heat in collaterals Deep unconsiousness

Sudden fall into unconsiousness,hemiplegia, rattling of phlegm in throat, vexation, biting of teeth, clenched fists, fever, flushed face, yellow and dry coat on tongue, rapid pulse Coma caused by rising liver Yang Deep unconsiousness

Coma, delirium, yellowish skin, nausea, vomiting, rashes over the body, epistaxis, abdominal distursion, typanic as drum, high fever at night, dark urine, constipation, dark red tongue with yellow and slimmy coat, rapid and taut pulse Coma caused by upward attack of heat and dampness Deep unconsiousness

Melancholy without any cause, suspicion, parabhonia ;abnormality of voice, paraphobia, irritability, somnolence, sudden suffocating sensation, hiccup, aphonia, convulsion, wiry and thready pulse, in severe cases loss of consciousness and syncope Hysteria Psychologic Conflict

Symptoms before seizure are dizziness, headache, suffocating sensation in the chest, listlessness. Symptoms during seizure are fainting, clenched jaws, upward movement of eyeballs, fits, mouth frothing, white slippery coat on tongue etc Epileptic Seizure Brain

After epileptic seizure therebis Increased Heartbeat, loss of appetite, expressionless face, listlessness, excess phlegm, weak and painful limbs,white coat on yellow tongue, thready pulse Post epileptic seizure Brain

Before seizure symptoms are dizziness, oppressive sensation in the chest, general malaise. During seizure symptoms are sudden fall and loss of consciousness, spitting saliva, strange sound from mouth, incontinence of urine and stool, white and slimmy coat on tongue, tant and slippery pulse Epileptic seizure caused by Wind phlegm obstruction Brain

Before attack symptoms are excess anger, dysphoria, insomnia, bitter taste in mouth, dry throat, cough with sputum, dark urine and constipation. During attack symptoms are sudden fall and loss of consciousness, convulsion, saliva spitting, screaming Epileptic seizure due to excess phlegm in the interior Brain

Unconsiousness, upward guaging, stiff neck, lock jaw, opisthotonus, contracture of limbs, rapid and taut pulse. Other symptoms are fever, headache, cough, congested throat, thirst, irritation Infantile Convulsion Involuntary muscle contractions and relaxation

Convulsion, unconsiousness, fever, anorexia, vomiting, abdominal distension and pain, foul smelling stool with constipation, sputum gurgling in throat Acute infantile convulsion due to internal wind produced by internal phlegm heat Muscles

Convulsion caused by sudden fright, cold limbs, no fever, disturbed sleep, lethargy, crying and fearing after waking, intermittent contraction of muscles Acute infantile convulsion due to sudden fright disturbing the mind Muscles

Intermittent convulsion, lassitude, lethargy with eyes open, pale complexion, cold limbs, loose stools, undigested food in stool, profuse and clear urination, weak and deep pulse Chronic infantile convulsion Muscles
Involuntary muscle contraction and relaxation Convulsions Muscles

Wry mouth with distorted eye, stiff tongue and slurred speech, hemianesthesia, drooling from corner of mouth, contracture pain, white coat on tongue, tant and slippery pulse Windstroke of meridian and collateral Brain
Hemiplegia, slurred speech, stiff tongue, malaise, hemianesthesia, palpitations, dark red tongue with white coat, thready and uneven pulse Windstroke due to Qi deficiency and blood stasis Brain

Wry mouth with distorted eye, tongue stiffness, slurred speech, hemianesthesia, salivation from corner of the mouth, contracture pain, white and slimmy tongue coat, tant and slippery pulse, epigastric distension and fullness, constipation, foul breathing, anorexia, thick yellow slimmy coat on tongue, slippery and rapid pulse Windstroke Brain
Sudden fall and loss of unconsiousness, lock jaw or taismus, clenched fists with urination and defecation, cramps in limbs or body Apoplectiform attack on yin organs causing tight syndromes Brain

Sudden fall with loss of consciousness, eyes closed and mouth open, respiration feeble, snoring with weak sound, fists open, limbs cold, profuse sweating, incontinence of urine and stool, flaccid paralysis of limbs, Flaccidity of tongue, feeble and thready pulse with impending stoppage Apoplectiform Attack on yin visceral organs causing collapse syndrome Brain

Dizziness aggravated by anger, irritation, red eyes, flushed face, bitter taste in mouth, tinnitus, dream disturbed sleep, red tongue with yellow coat, rapid pulse Rising liver Yang causing Dizziness Head

Dizziness accompanied by pallor and aggravated by overwork, weakness, palpitations, glowless face, pale lips and nails, tiredness, anorexia, pale tongue, weak pulse, dizziness post loss of blood or serious disease Dizziness caused by deficiency of Qi and blood Head
Dizziness with heaviness in head, suffocation in chest, nausea, excess sputum, anorexia, somnolence, white sticky coat on tongue, soft and rolling pulse Dizziness due to retention of phlegm damp Head

Seeping uterine hemorrhage in scanty continuous bleeding Uterine hemorrhage Uterus

Abdominal pain and feeling of cold with uterine bleeding due to cold Uterine hemorrhage Uterus

First stage of epidemic fever called as fever and hemorragic stage with main symptoms high fever, skin rashes, profuse sweating, headache, thirst, lumbar pain, reddened face as if drunk, congested eyes, epistaxis, spitting blood, chills in early stage, impaired consciousness, severe noxious heat, deep coloured urine, constipation, schizophrenia, loss of consciousness, delirium, convulsion, Opisthotus, red tongue with yellow coat with prickles, rapid and slippery pulse Epidemic Fever Infectious disease of Virus origin

Second stage of epidemic fever called hypotense shock stage where in symptoms are still feverish, sudden drop of high temperature, profuse sweating, dysphoria, thirst, malaise, reduced skin eruption, drop in BP, four limbs cold,deep red tongue, rapid and forceless pulse Epidemic fever Viral infectious disease

Fourth stage of epidemic fever called polyuria stage where the symptoms are frequent urination, excess clear urine, incontinence of urine, dizziness, dry mouth, thirst, lumbar soreness, malaise, spiritlessness, light coloured tongue with thin white coat, fine and weak pulse Epidemic fever Viral infectious disease

Third stage of epidemic fever called Oliguria stage where the symptoms are scanty deep coloured urine, dysuria, anuria, hematuria, distending pain in lower abdomen, sore back and lion, dysphoria, constipation, red tongue with yellow coat, rapid and fine pulse Epidemic fever Viral infectious disease

Fifth stage of epidemic fever called convalescent stage where the symptoms are low grade fever not cleared yet, dry mouth and throat, spontaneous sweating, dizziness, malaise, loose stools, lumbar ache, light coloured tongue with thin white coat, weak and fine pulse Epidemic fever Viral infectious disease

Fever due to attack of external wind heat causing high fever and mild chilliness, headache, cough, less thirst, dry and sore throat, snuffy nose, red tongue margins and tip, thin white or yellow coat on tongue, floating and rapid pulse Fever unknown Body temperature

Fever due to both external and internal syndromes causes alternation of chills and fever, painful fullness of chest and hypochondrium, nausea, bitter taste, dizziness, blurred vision, anorexia, vexation, dryness in pharynx, white wet tongue coat and taut pulse Fever unknown Body temperature

Fever due to internal attack causing excess heat in Qi system with high fever, thirst, sweating, painful swelling of gum with erosion or bleeding, red tongue with dry yellow coat, full and large pulse Fever unknown Body temperature

Fever due to internal attack, due to excess heat in yin system causing high fever at night, insomnia, thirsty but drinks very little, also in severe cases coma, delirium, vague skin rashes, dry and red tongue, thin and rapid pulse Fever unknown Body temperature
Fever due to internal attack of heat in heart causing high fever, coma, delirium, deep red and dry tongue with yellow coat, rapid pulse Fever unknown Body temperature

Fever due to internal attack damp heat in liver and biliary tract causing fever, jaundice, hypochondriac pain, epigastric fullness, abdominal distension, scanty dark urine, nausea, vomiting, bitter taste, thirst, red tongue with yellow wet coat, taut and rapid pulse Fever unknown Body temperature

Fever due to internal attack, damp heat in Urinary bladder causing fever, frequent urination, dysuria, difficult and painful urination, lumbar pain, red tongue with wet yellow coat, rapid pulse Fever unknown Body temperature

With viral bronchitis small amount of mucous are are often coughed up.When the coughed up mucous changes from white to green or yellow, the condition may have been complicated by a bacterial infection. High fever may be as 101F to 103F,It lasts for 3 to 5 days.the cough continues for several weeks or even longer to resolve.Feeling of heat.Breathlessness.Coughing of yellow sputum.thirst.Restlessness.Sweating.Red tongue with yellow coating.Rapid and overflowing pulse  Attack of external wind heat changing into internal lungs heat causes acute bronchitis with high fever, feeling of heat and coughing of yellow sputum.

Acute pneumonia,High fever,Feeling of heat,Restlessness, thirst, Vomiting after drinking , Cough, Breathlessness, Pain in chest, Coughing of profuse amountsof yellow sticky phlegm, Oppression in chest,Nausea, Dry stools,Dark urine,Red tongue with sticky yellowcoating,Rapid and slippery pulse. Attack of external wind heat changing into internal lungs phlegm heat causes acute pneumonia with high fever , feeling of heat and coughing of profuse yellow sticky sputum.

High fever,Intense thirst, Profuse sweating,Feeling of heat, restlessness, Coarse breathing,Bleeding and sore gums,Red tongue with dry yellow coating, over flowing or big pulse.  Attack of external wind heat changing into acute stomach heat causes four bigs - i.e Big fever, Big thirst, Big sweating and Big pulse.

High fever which is worse in the afternoon,Constipation dry stools, Anus burning, Abdominal pain and fullness which is worse with pressure,restless,Thirst, Delirium. Red tongue with dry thick yellow,brown or black coating . Deep full and rapid pulse Attack of external wind heat changing into acute stomach and intestines dry heat and fire causes high fever  which is worse in the afternoon , dry stools, burning in anus and mild delirium.

Alternating feeling of hot and cold , more hot than cold. Thirst,d Attack of external wind heat changing acute Gall bladder heat causes post viral alternating feeling of hot and cold, more hot than cold , bitter taste , hypochondrial pain and Nausea.

Alternating hot and cold with more cold than hot. Post viral fatigue syndromes. bitter taste, Dry throat, Hypochondrial pain. Blurred vision, No thirst,Irritation and anger,Vomiting, White coating on the right side of the tongue. Wiry and fine pulse. Attack of external wind heat changing into lesser yang pattern causes post viral feeling of alternating cold and hot with more cold than hot , bitter taste, hypochondrial pain and vomitng.

Continuous fever which decreases after sweating but then returns.Post viral syndromes. Nausea, Loose stools, A sticky taste. Heavyness of the body and head. Oppressionin the chest and epigastrium.Poor appetite.Red tonguewith asticky yellow coating . Rapid and slippery pulse. Attack of external wind heat changing into humid heat in spleen and stomach causes continuous fever which decreases after sweating but then returns  heavyness in head and body ,loose stools and Nausea.

Sudden collapse,Loss of conciousness, Coma, Hand and Mouth Open, Eye closed, Pale face, Oily Sweat on Forehead, Incontinence of stool and urine,Cold limbs,Pale and swollen tongue. Minute,hidden,and scattered pulse.  Flaccid (or open) type of Wind Stroke. Brain.
Unilateral Paralysis of Limbs. Numbness. Deviation of Eye and Mouth. slurred speech.There is no loss of conciousness or coma. Attack of wind on meridians alone causes mild type of Wind Stroke.
Facial Paralysis. Hemiplegia.Numbness of Limbs. Limitation of Movement.Slurred Speech may be there.There is Hemiplegia and numbness both in this type. wind Stroke Attack of Main Meridians

Unilateral numbness of face and limbs.Slurred speech may be there.   There is no loss of conciousness or coma. there is only numbness in this type ofwind stroke.  Wind Stroke attack of wind on the Connecting Meridians.

Summary of Patterns in the Sequelae stage of Wind Stroke and Their Treatments.

Hemiplegiaused by obstruction of meridians by wind and phlegm.Stiffness of the jointsand contraction of the muscles is due to  stasis of blood.Obstruction in the meridians by the pathogenic factor has a background of QI deficiency, blood deficiency or yin deficiency. If the Left side of the body is affected by hemiplegia, it may be due to  blood deficiency and consequent blood stasis. If the right side of the body is affected by  hemoplegia , it may be due to phlegm, fire and Qi deficiency. Hemiplegia.

Wind stroke facial Paralysis symptoms are- Eyes are not affected. Movement of eyebrows and furrowing of the forehead are normal. Facial Paralysis is caused by stroke due to internal Wind. Peripheral Facial Paralysis symptoms are - There is deviation of an eye and mouth. The patient is able to move one eyebrow only on the healthy side when trying to frown and furrowing the forehead. This type of facial Paralysis is caused by external wind. Facial Paralysis

Deficiency Type Syncope (Xu type or Flaccid type) symptoms are- Shallow Breathing, Mouth Agape, Sweating, Pallor, Cold Extremities. Deep , feeble and Thready pulse. Excesstype (Shi or Tense type) Syncope symptoms are - Coarse breathing, Rigid extremities, Clenched Jaws. Deep and forceful pulse. SYNCOPE.

This is caused by wind. The pain moves from joint to joint.Ther is soreness and pain of muscles and joints and limitation of movement. During the initial acute phase ther may be redness and swelling or Wind intolerance. The tongue coating is thin and white. Floating Pulse. Wind painful Occlusion Syndrome.

This is caused by Dampness.The pain is fixed in one place and the pain is aggravated by damp Weather. There is pain and swelling in muscles and joints.In acute cases the pulse is slow and slightly slippery.Numbness of adjacent tissues. Generalised Aches.Heaviness in the hands and feet and reduced mobility. The tongue coating is white and greasy. Damp Painful Occlusion Syndrome.

This is caused by cold. There is severe pain in ajount or muscle. The movement is limited. The pain is usually unilateral. In acute cases the pulse is tight. The pain is on a fixed location. The pain is aggravated by cold and ameliorated by warmth. Ther is reduced mobility of the joints. Absence of redness, warmth, or swelling in the affected joint. The tongue coating is white. Cold Painful Occlusion Syndrome.

Attack of external pathogenic factor, Gradually take the form of pathogenic factor internal heat and person suffers from painful Occlusion Syndrome. Deficiency of Yin. There is no pain and heat in the joints. There is limitation of movement. There is severe pain. The pain is ameliorated by cold. There may be fever and thirst in acute cases. The fever does not go even after sweating. Pulse is slippery and rapid. The tongue is red with yellow dry coating. Since the pain and fever is due to humid heat, the sweating does not bring any relief in fever or pain. Infact dampness is primary syndrome and heat is secondary in this case. Heat Painful Occlusion Syndrome.

This is a chronic condition. At first painful Occlusion Syndrome develops due to any of the four types referred above. Continuous occlusion of the joints by the pathogenic factors causes retention of body fluids. The body fluids turn into phlegm which further obstructs the joints and channels. This causes muscular atrophy and swelling and deformity of the bones of the joints. This is extreme form of phlegm. In this stage painful Occlusion Syndrome becomes an internal syndrome affecting not only the muscles , joints and meridians, but also the internal organs. First of all, the obstruction of the circulation of QI, blood and body fluids caused by phlegm may lead to stasis of blood. The stasis of blood in the meridians further obstructs proper circulation and therefore is another cause of further pain. In many cases, muscle wasting and atrophy, tendon contractue, Inability to extend the elbow and the knee joints may be there. There may be generalised ankylosis and disability. The toungue is dusky red. The pulse is thread like and impeded. Bone painful Occlusion Syndrome.
